name: Fails to create an account to user that already has an account
scenarioId: classpath:features/account/create_account:Fails to create an account to user that already has an account
methodName: Fails to create an account to user that already has an account

testSteps.description: Given a client for account creation with document identification: document type "NATIONAL_ID", document "03485203948", country "PT"
And the client requesting the account creation has its register active in the agency "0001"
And the client's account already exists
When the account creation is requested
Then the client's account is not created

reportData.title: User Bank Account Creations Response
reportData.contents: <400 BAD_REQUEST Bad Request,RestResponse(message=The user already has an account., data=null),[connection:"close", content-type:"application/json", date:"Wed, 25 Dec 2024 14:30:07 GMT", transfer-encoding:"chunked"]>

userStory.narrative:
For a client to be able to do banking transactions as a Tiny Bank client, he needs to have an account. For simplification
  purposes, there will be only one account per client. The account creation is done based on the client's national ID. Those
  test scenarios take in consideration that based on the client's national ID the user information is recovered, and then
  the account is created.

  **As a** Tiny Bank client
  **I want to** create a bank account
  **So that I can** do bank transactions through Tiny Bank

title: Fails to create an account to user that already has an account

rule.name: The user that already has an account cannot create a new account
